title: Garens mark has a couple of problems
body:
i seems rather... random. and it seems like he has no control over it.

- does it have limited range or does it work global?
- what happens if the mark applies to a low priority target, like that thresh who got the most recent kills by random lasthits, while the adc did 90% of the damage and didnt get many kills off it? (rare but situations like these happen)
- what happens in a teamfight when kills are exchanged and the mark possibly jumps from one target to the next? hes just about to finish the guy with the mark, then a kill causes it to jump to the next opponent?
- what happens if the mark applies to a champion he simply cant fight or reach? like kallista or an adc protected by a janna? ther eis a bunch of champions that can kite him pretty much indefinitely. here just a few examples {{champion:22}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:81}} {{champion:13}} {{champion:236}} those are just a bunch i noticed while looking through the champion pool.

there are too many random factors playing into the way the target is chosen for my taste.

imo he should be able to chose his mark himself, but put heavy restrictions onto the ability to change it instead. for example, he cant change his mark until he has killed (and dealt justice to) the current one.

or there is an exceptionally long cooldown to the ability to switch the mark, so he cant change it willy nilly in a teamfight. and the enemy team can paly around it by protecting the marked target.




also, reading all these changes it sounds nice on the surface. but there is little chance that you added this mechanic to his kit without removing something in return. please be honest and tell us where you made cuts in his kit for this gimmick.

replies.body:
Villainy's global. It's certainly possible that an enemy might end up picking a lot of killing blows and so be the Villain despite not being a great target, as per your Thresh example, that's something we feels appropriate though. One of the goals with Villainy is to sometimes give Garen another choice to make in combat - do I go for the Villain or do I go for another target who's a higher priority for me, but who I might be less effective against?

Villainy's also set up so it won't change mid combat, sudden change of Villain screwing you over shouldn't be a thing. It's definitely possible, and will likely be relatively common, that Villainy ends up on a champion Garen has trouble reaching. Something we want to do here is make it much more rewarding for Garen's team to help him get onto targets he can't easily reach himself. At present that's often not a good call, you're better off just leaving Garen to his own devices and saving CC to set up or peel for other allies.

As far as other changes go this stuff should be hitting the PBE pretty soon. Biggest changes from memory are lower early game damage and higher late game damage.

he moved 20% slower through minions. and that was intended as a mechanic for the early lane phase so he couldnt chase down/kite champions through creepwaves too easily. and it sucked, because it was as anoying lategame as it was early. you scratched a monster during a jungle chase or a minion in a teamfight, and you lost all ability to stick.

nerfing his movement while he spins on champions. this is a whole other level of stupidity. its like they dont want him to be able to actually get in ranage of a target and then stick to it.

it also cripples his ability to use the spin on multiple targets. you cant move around very well anymore to keep 2 people in range of the spin at the same time.

i also didnt mention that they removed the tenacity from his w.

valid point but im waiting to see the actual results myself.  The biggest thing that i have with all the complaints is that everyone says "its such a massive nerf" and it doesnt seem like that massive a nerf to me.  In reality the key flaws of garen still exist still kitable still requires flanking, but now he gets, theoretically, more damage.  So until we get PBE feedback I would say hold off on judgement, yes pun intended, of garen's E and the rest of his kit.

Yes, i can definetly see myself about to execute someone with my true damage, only to have the mark disapear because the enemy ADC on the other side of the map managed to get a kill.


Hopefully they will, at least, add a ''The Villain will not change if Garen has damaged it in the last [X] seconds'' clause, or something to help it's reliability.

Especially since the notes stated that Garen's early game is getting nerfed.

I think it is obvious that rioters haven't played smite before because this new passive is very similar to the god kali, who i think has the worst passive ever put into a moba. she marks a target at random. Kali gains a Physical Penetration bonus against that god, and if she lands the killing blow, she heals for 80% of her maximum Health and recieves a +25% gold bonus. A new Death Mark is selected any time her current target dies, or if Kali dies it is set to whoever last hit her. if you have ever played kali then you would soon see how terrible this passive is. unlike kali garen is tanky and doesn't depend on the killing the enemy to be able to fight, but both cannot control who gets the mark and both are will have to be balanced around the optimal circumstance. if her marks line up perfectly for her she can easily 1v5 an enemy team. however, the chances of that happening are so low its not ever worth giving it a number, but even though she almost never gets that situation she must be balanced around it because there is still a chance. 

the problem with garens new ult passive is that it will be extremely OP in the extremely unlikely chance that everything lines up(because it is random), but completely useless when it doesn't line up at all. if it goes anything like a game playing kali then 80% of the time it does almost nothing for you aside from a little bonus dmg. But, even though it will be mostly worthless(ex. mark is in another lane, they are out of reach, it's on a bad target .etc) garen will have to be balanced with the "optimal" situation in mind.

in conclusion giving a champ a huge strength that the have zero control over is a bad idea. also, this a jg passive not a lane passive and it will all but complete make him unable to chose where he ganks because the mark will chose for him. this passive looks like a balancing nightmare just like kali's is for her.
